title: raybucks
author: raybucks
content: Hey everyone,I’m looking for some recommendations on the best Bitcoin wallets and multi-chain wallets. I prefer open-source wallets, but I’m having trouble finding reliable ones, especially multi-chain ones.Some issues I’ve faced:I found wallets that support multiple chains, but they haven’t been updated in a while. The GitHub community is also not very active, which raises some doubts about the security or if anything has changed in the wallet.Open-source wallets are great, but I’m unsure if they’re still secure when they aren’t updated often.So, I’m wondering:What are some of the best open-source multi-chain wallets?How do you feel about wallets that aren’t updated regularly?Any risks with using open-source wallets with inactive development?

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: You can use Unstoppable wallet or Metamask. I prefer to use Unstoppable but it has synchronizing issue with some coins. I only use it for stable coins because I do not hold altcoins and I like the wallet. I have noticed that close source wallets are more good for altcoins except Metamask, unless you go for hardware wallet like Trezor which is also good for altcoins.

comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.body: I would say Aqua wallet, because it supports liquid network and lightning network, open source and non custodial.Blockstream green also have all features like Aqua wallet, but AFAIK they uses multi sig wallet, so you have 1 from 2 private keys since the project own the another key. You can recover your coins only in Blockstream green, you can't do it on other wallets.

comments.author: BenCodie
comments.body: Electrum is a great lightweight wallet for Bitcoin. It's also been forked for other Bitcoin chains (do be careful for fake electrum websites there are plenty around). For EVM chains, Metamask is my top preference, I personally think it's the leader among EVM wallets, and adding a network is as simple as adding the RPC information for that chain. Other wallets like Phantom are multichain and includes Bitcoin I believe though I do not think it's open source (it's become very popular though).

comments.author: Zaguru12
comments.body: First of all I don’t advice the use of multi chain wallet for bitcoin, for me the best thing is to have a separate wallet only for bitcoin and my suggestion for bitcoin wallet is electrum and BlueWallet which both are open source wallet and do have regular updates. As for other chain, my suggestion is to go for unstoppable wallet or Metamask wallet, although the two wallets do no have all chains. This wallet suggestions are all hot wallets which are not advisable for long term and large amount storage. So for cold wallets I will advise you go for hardware wallet which are open source like passport and Trezor. Avoid wallets that do not have regular update for firmware and the rest even if they are open source

comments.author: sokani
comments.body: I'd recommend unstoppable wallet. It's non custodial, support multi chains and it's available to both android and IOS users. From your description of the kind of wallet you want, I think it ticks the boxes. Since launching, there have been numerous releases and the latest was Dec 25, 2024 (for android) and Oct 02, 2024 (for IOS), so it's being regularly updated. You can find information about this and more on the Github page: https://github.com/horizontalsystems

comments.author: Mia Chloe
comments.body: Quote from: _act_ on February 03, 2025, 01:32:28 PMI prefer to use Unstoppable but it has synchronizing issue with some coins. I only use it for stable coins because I do not hold altcoins and I like the wallet.Yeah I think unstoppable wallet would be a good pick for a multi coin wallet basically sometimes I work with stable coins and most of the time and also make use of unstoppable wallet but just like you said I also notice they have a couple of syncing issues sometimes even with the Bitcoin network it sometimes takes some time depending on your network speed to sync with the blockchain.They are more closed source wallets for altcoins than you can find open source wallet. Nevertheless if it's just for bitcoin only I prefer and I also suggest ELECTRUM. I don't make use of metamask because it seems very vulnerable and many stories of phishing attacks I've seen are usually on metamask.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: raybucks on February 03, 2025, 12:58:42 PMI’m looking for some recommendations on the best Bitcoin wallets and multi-chain wallets. I prefer open-source wallets, but I’m having trouble finding reliable ones, especially multi-chain ones.There a few options available and I think Cake wallet is one of the best options currently.It is open source, available both on mobile devices and desktop computers, and they have some cutting edge privacy features like Bitcoin silent payments, litecoin mweb addresses, etc.Another solid option is Stack wallet, that is also available on mobile devices and computers.Unstoppable wallet is availble only for mobile devices, and you can also use hardware wallets Like Trezor or Keystone.

comments.author: Smartprofit
comments.body: Quote from: dkbit98 on February 07, 2025, 05:38:51 PMQuote from: raybucks on February 03, 2025, 12:58:42 PMI’m looking for some recommendations on the best Bitcoin wallets and multi-chain wallets. I prefer open-source wallets, but I’m having trouble finding reliable ones, especially multi-chain ones.There a few options available and I think Cake wallet is one of the best options currently.It is open source, available both on mobile devices and desktop computers, and they have some cutting edge privacy features like Bitcoin silent payments, litecoin mweb addresses, etc.Another solid option is Stack wallet, that is also available on mobile devices and computers.Unstoppable wallet is availble only for mobile devices, and you can also use hardware wallets Like Trezor or Keystone.Yes, Cake Wallet is a great wallet. I use it from time to time. Many users consider it as a wallet for storing Monero (and it really works great for this purpose). Crypto enthusiasts who love Monero are by definition paranoid, seeking more anonymity and privacy. And this fact alone suggests that this is a pretty reliable cryptocurrency wallet. It has a very user-friendly interface and intuitive coin management. It also has a convenient exchanger built in. Another great wallet is Electrum. It is designed to store and manage Bitcoin, and it copes with this role very well. It is also an open source project that has been around for many years. Electrum wallet also exists in both mobile (Android, IOS) and desktop versions (it is very convenient). In fact, it has all the necessary features for managing Bitcoin.
